H0.text: 2HO is the product necessary to complete the reaction of sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO₃) with hydrochloric acid (HCl) to produce sodium chloride (NaCl) and carbon dioxide (CO₂).

H1.text: HO₂ is the product necessary to make the double replacement reaction between sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO₃) and stomach acid (HCl) complete, yielding NaCl, CO₂, and HO₂.

H2.text: H₂O₂ is the product necessary to make the neutralization of stomach acid by sodium bicarbonate complete, producing NaCl, CO₂, and H₂O₂.

H3.text: H₂O is the product necessary to complete the double replacement reaction in which sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO₃) neutralizes stomach acid (HCl) to produce sodium chloride (NaCl) and carbon dioxide (CO₂).
